title: Apigee - Manage deployments
abstract:
# Apigee - Manage deployments
**    Preview    — Apigee API hub ** This feature is subject to the "Pre-GA Offerings Terms" in the General Service Terms section   of the [Service Specific Terms](/terms/service-terms#1) .     Pre-GA features are available "as is" and might have limited support.    For more information, see the [launch stage descriptions](/products#product-launch-stages) .
An API can have multiple deployments. For example: different staging environments or regions. A  deployment is a location (an address) where users can access an API. One of these deployments  can be indicated as the [recommended deployment](#specify-recommended-deployment) .
The **Deployments** tab displays all deployments for the API configured by a user with [edit permissions](/apigee/docs/api-hub/permissions#roles) . Deployments are  listed alphabetically by environment.
content:
## Add deployment
To add a deployment:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- Select the **Deployments** tab.
- Click **Add deployment** 
- Enter or select the following:- **ID:** An identifier for an API resource. The ID can contain only lowercase    letters, numbers, and hyphens. The ID must be unique in the project. IDs must be    between 4 and 63 characters long. IDs cannot be changed once a deployment has    been created.
- **Environment:** The location where an instance of an API is available.    For example: Production, Staging, Test, etc.
- **Gateway:** The gateway type. The proxy used to serve and protect the API. Defined    as a [system taxonomy](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies#system-taxonomies) .
- **API version:** The [version](/apigee/docs/api-hub/versions) of the API that is provided by this deployment. If a version has no [revisions](/apigee/docs/api-hub/revisions) , it is marked as such in the    list and cannot be selected.
- **External channel** name and URL: A label and URL for a link to an external channel    for the API, such as a Developer Portal
- **Access information** - **Usage guidance:** Guidance specifying the audience for the deployment.     For example, public consumption, internal testing, etc.
- **Server endpoint:** The server endpoint for the API
- **Access guidance:** Free-form markdown content describing how API consumers can [get access](#get-access) to the deployment
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).## Edit deployment
To edit a deployment:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- Select the **Deployments** tab.
- Clickmore_vert **More** >edit **Edit** next to the desired deployment.
- Make modifications as necessary.
- **Update revision:** This check box is displayed when the currently selected version   has a spec revision that is newer than the one that is already assigned to the deployment.   Select this box to update the deployed spec revision.
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).## Delete deployment
To delete a deployment:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- Select the **Deployments** tab.
- Clickmore_vert **More** >delete **Delete** next to the desired deployment.
- Click **Delete** (or **Cancel** ) at the prompt.
## Specify recommended deployment
To set or clear a recommended deployment:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- Select the **Deployments** tab.
- On the desired deployment row, clickmore_vert **More** >push_pin **Set as recommended** .   You cannot clear a recommended deployment; you can   only specify a different deployment as the recommended deployment.## Get access
**Note:** **Access information** is specified as part of the deployment. For more information, See [Add deployment](#add-deployment) .
To view information on how to get access to an API:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- From the **General** pane or the **Deployments** tab,   click **Get access** to open the **Access** API panel. If there is no **Get access** button, no information has been provided. See [Add deployment](#add-deployment) for   instructions on adding access information.
- Select a **Deployment** from the list. If a deployment has no access information,   it is marked as such in the list and cannot be selected.## Go to external channel
**Note:** An external channel is defined when you create a deployment. For more information, See [Add deployment](#add-deployment) .
To navigate to an external channel:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- Select the **Deployments** tab.
- Click an **External channel** link to navigate to an external channel, such as a   portal, if one has been [defined](#add-deployment) .
